p: The potential energy surfaces of the ZnO–liquid-water interfaces were described by a high-dimensional neural network potential (NNP), that we previously developed and validated for the ZnO–liquid-water interface using training data for both the ZnO(101[combining macron]0) and ZnO(112[combining macron]0) surface in contact with liquid water. 34 The NNP was parameterized to reproduce dispersion-corrected DFT-calculated energies and forces at the RPBE-D3 level of theory. 47, 48 RPBE-D3 has been shown to describe liquid water, 49 as well as proton transfer reactions in NaOH solutions, 36 very well.
